author: Lusa
title: Federa√ß√£o dos m√©dicos diz que protocolo negocial ficou "aqu√©m das expetativas" - Pol√≠tica - Correio da Manh√£
text:
Aluno de 16 anos morre de meningite em Odivelas Enfermeira viu alem√£o procurado pela Pol√≠cia Judici√°ria junto ao Hospital de Viseu Padroeiro da Internet que morreu aos 15 anos vai ser o novo santo da Igreja Grupo rapta e marca rapaz com ferro em brasa na Moita Morreu Morgan Spurlock, o realizador que comeu McDonald's durante um m√™s para gravar document√°rio Letizia e Felipe VI j√° vivem separados. Saiba tudo aqui Taylor Swift faz a terra tremer? Investigadores v√£o medir atividade s√≠smica durante concertos Namorado de Taylor Swift j√° est√° em Lisboa e dever√° assistir ao concerto da cantora David Carreira e Carolina Carvalho v√£o ser pais pela segunda vez? Saiba tudo aqui Veja o v√≠deo da incr√≠vel festa "Somos Todos Gamers" com os convidados especiais In√™s Aires Pereira fala da separa√ß√£o As conversas comprometedoras que tramaram Fernando Madureira O homem que queria matar Andr√© Ventura e o p√¢nico no voo SQ321 Quem s√£o as v√≠timas do desabamento de restaurante em Palma de Maiorca "Os √∫ltimos sete meses t√™m sido um pesadelo": Irm√£o de jovem raptada pelo Hamas revela ang√∫stia da fam√≠lia IPMA alerta para aumento de caravelas-portuguesas nas zonas costeiras. Saiba que cuidados deve ter Quer receber as √∫ltimas not√≠cias no seu telem√≥vel ainda mais r√°pido? Siga aqui o ALERTA CM Federa√ß√£o dos m√©dicos diz que protocolo negocial ficou "aqu√©m das expetativas" Em causa est√° a quest√£o das grelhas salariais" e a reposi√ß√£o das 35 horas de trabalho semanais. Lusa 14:53 M√©dicos FOTO: Pexels A Federa√ß√£o Nacional dos M√©dicos (Fnam) afirmou esta sexta-feira que o protocolo negocial apresentado pela tutela ficou "aqu√©m das expectativas", por n√£o conter mat√©rias que considera serem obrigat√≥rias, como as grelhas salariais e a reposi√ß√£o das 35 horas semanais. √Ä sa√≠da da segunda reuni√£o com a equipa ministerial da Sa√∫de, liderada por Ana Paula Martins, que durou cerca de 90 minutos, a presidente da Fnam, Joana Bordalo e S√° adiantou que o que foi apresentado pela tutela foi a revis√£o da avalia√ß√£o dos m√©dicos, do sistema integrado de gest√£o e avalia√ß√£o do desempenho na Administra√ß√£o P√∫blica e da quest√£o dos m√©dicos internos.
Para a dirigente sindical, o que foi apresentado "est√° aqu√©m" das expectativas da Fnam. "N√≥s queremos obrigatoriamente ter inclu√≠do neste protocolo negocial, a quest√£o das grelhas salariais" e a reposi√ß√£o das 35 horas de trabalho semanais.
Al√©m disso, defendeu, o protocolo deve tamb√©m fazer "a revisita√ß√£o de legisla√ß√£o que foi publicada no tempo do anterior governo", onde √© necess√°rio "revisitar mat√©rias inconstitucionais", relacionadas com a dedica√ß√£o plena.
Outra legisla√ß√£o que a Fnam defende dever ser 'revisitada' refere-se √†s unidades de sa√∫de familiar e aos centros de responsabilidade integrados.
Joana Bordalo e S√° disse n√£o ter sido poss√≠vel "assinar um protocolo negocial", uma decis√£o tamb√©m tomada pelo Sindicato Independente dos M√©dicos (SIM) que se reuniu primeiro com a ministra da Sa√∫de.
"De qualquer forma, o Governo mostrou alguma abertura para rever estas nossas propostas e ficou combinada uma reuni√£o dentro de um m√™s, onde veremos se efetivamente estas propostas estar√£o no protocolo negocial ou n√£o", assinalou Joana Bordalo e S√°.
A l√≠der sindical adiantou que a Federa√ß√£o Nacional dos M√©dicos vai ter que analisar internamente a proposta, mas reiterou que, "por agora" n√£o estaria nunca em condi√ß√µes de assinar o protocolo negocial
Questionada sobre se a Fnam saiu com as expectativas goradas, a sindicalista afirmou que o que ficou acordado √© que haveria abertura por parte do Minist√©rio da Sa√∫de "para ver se h√° margem para incorporar estes eixos", notando que a quest√£o da grelha salarial √© fundamental porque os m√©dicos em Portugal "continuam a ser dos mais mal pagos a n√≠vel europeu", o que leva a que "os colegas, sobretudo os que se formam, saem para o setor privado, saem para a imigra√ß√£o e n√£o h√° maneira de ficarem no Servi√ßo Nacional de Sa√∫de".
Sobre o que a Fnam pretende fazer caso estes temas n√£o sejam inclu√≠dos no protocolo, Joana Bordalo e S√° disse que o objetivo principal agora √© encontrar solu√ß√µes para os m√©dicos e perceber "se esta equipa ministerial tem a sensibilidade de perceber que s√£o mat√©rias que t√™m mesmo que estar [no documento] se querem efetivamente fazer algo de √∫til e concreto para ter m√©dicos no Servi√ßo Nacional de Sa√∫de, para poder servir a popula√ß√£o".
"Caso n√£o estejam inclu√≠dos, logo se ver√° tamb√©m se o n√≠vel de contesta√ß√£o ter√° que acontecer ou ter√° que aumentar, esperemos que n√£o. N√£o √© este o nosso objetivo", declarou.
Antes de entrar para a reuni√£o, a sindicalista disse aos jornalistas que "o SNS n√£o pode esperar mais".
"N√≥s temos falta de m√©dicos e n√£o √© s√≥ no servi√ßo de urg√™ncia. Estamos em maio e j√° estamos com tantas falhas que nem percebemos bem o que vai acontecer no ver√£o ou como √© que vai ser at√© ao inverno. Portanto, os planos j√° deveriam estar feitos", defendeu.
Lembrou, por outro lado, que 17% da popula√ß√£o n√£o tem m√©dico de fam√≠lia, o que considerou ser uma situa√ß√£o "gritante", e alertou tamb√©m para a falta de m√©dicos em v√°rias especialidades.
A ministra da Sa√∫de come√ßou as reuni√µes √†s 10h00 com os representantes dos m√©dicos, seguindo-se v√°rios sindicatos dos enfermeiros.

author: Listin Diario
title: "Celebran festividad del Santo Cristo de Bayaguana"| List√≠n Diario
text: Celebran festividad del Santo Cristo de Bayaguana La tradicional festividad del Santo Cristo de los Milagros se llev√≥ a cabo en Bayaguana, Monte Plata, este 28 de diciembre. Las principales actividades de la festividad religiosa del Santo Cristo cont√≥ con la asistencia de fieles feligreses, principalmente en el nuevo templo del Cristo y la parroquia San Juan Bautista. Bayaguana, con su ya arraigada celebraci√≥n del Santo Cristo de los Milagros, atrae a cientos de visitantes de todo el pa√≠s y del extranjero, quienes son cautivados por la fe religiosa y los eventos destacados que se desarrollan durante las festividades. El comit√© organizador estuvo precedido por monse√±or Lorenzo Vargas, vicario del Santo Cristo de los Milagros, y el doctor Miguel Polanco Wessin, gerente general de la Cooperativa "El Progreso"; al que se suman, el p√°rroco Juan Luis Garc√≠a, Manuel Pantalio Santana, alcalde del referido municipio, representantes de la Hermandad de los Comisarios del Santo Cristo, Cuerpo de Bomberos, Polic√≠a Nacional, Defensa Civil, Asociaci√≥n de Caballistas, y representantes de sociedad civil. Esta festividad religiosa de Bayaguana, cuenta con m√°s de 200 a√±os de historia, incluyendo peregrinaciones de los comisarios del Cristo, quienes recorren diversas comunidades rurales buscando aportes en becerros que se destinan a la tradici√≥n cat√≥lica. El folklore, la expresi√≥n cultural, la religiosidad y la diversi√≥n estuvieron presentes en el sano y divertido espect√°culo de la festividad. El comit√© organizador dedic√≥ este a√±o la celebraci√≥n al fenecido comisario mayor-mayor, del on Wenceslao Rosario Carrera (Lalito), quien por mas de 40 a√±os dirigi√≥ la hermandad de comisarios del Cristo de los Milagros.

author: SCIENMAG
title: UAF Scientist Innovates Satellite Technology to Track Tiny Space Debris
text:
A promising initiative led by researchers at the University of Alaska Fairbanks (UAF) is set to revolutionize the field of space debris detection. Space debris, comprising defunct satellites, spent rocket stages, and fragments from previous collisions, poses a significant risk to operational spacecraft in low-Earth orbit. Currently, objects larger than 1 centimeter, approximately half an inch, remain undetectable from terrestrial observation systems, yet they possess the potential to inflict substantial damage to active satellites.
This endeavor, aimed at developing a specialized satellite equipped with advanced instruments, focuses primarily on detecting smaller pieces of orbital debris. The implications are far-reaching, particularly for the safety and sustainability of communication satellites that are integral to modern infrastructure. With the advent of this technology, future satellites could be empowered with the means to navigate around hazardous space debris, thus ensuring uninterrupted communication and operation in orbit.
Space debris travels at astonishing speeds, reaching approximately 17,500 miles per hour. At this velocity, a mere 1-centimeter object can generate an impact energy comparable to that of a hand grenade. The threat this presents is profound, as even small debris can compromise the integrity of entire spacecraft. Researchers emphasize that the consequences of collisions in orbit can be catastrophic, leading to mission failures and the creation of even more debris, further exacerbating the issue.
The scientific team led by UAF‚Äôs Geophysical Institute research professor Paul Bernhardt is pioneering a novel approach to detect these elusive debris objects. Alongside their collaborators from the University of Calgary in Canada, they have devised a method based on the interaction between orbiting objects and naturally occurring plasma disturbances, known as striations, that are aligned along Earth‚Äôs magnetic field lines. Plasma, a state of matter consisting of free electrons and ions, plays a critical role in the proposed detection mechanism.
Bernhardt‚Äôs methodology involves the generation of electromagnetic waves as satellites traverse through these plasma regions. The research team has engineered specialized sensors capable of simultaneously measuring electric and magnetic wave fields. By analyzing the signals emitted from the debris, these sensors can determine the distance and trajectory of space objects, marshalling data critical for avoiding potential collisions.
The instrument suite being developed will be housed on a satellite named the Space Debris Hunter, which is designed solely for the purpose of tracking debris too small for ground-based detection systems. This dedicated reconnaissance platform will represent a significant leap in the quest for space safety, providing the insights necessary for real-time collision avoidance maneuvers.
As stated by Bernhardt, acquiring consistent measurements will ensure the future trajectory of space debris can be predicted effectively. This new scientific frontier represents not only a technological advancement but also a paradigm shift in how we approach space debris management. The anticipated results could enable operators to preemptively steer satellites away from potential collision paths, significantly reducing the risk of catastrophic impacts in the increasingly crowded orbital environment.
The urgent need for enhanced debris detection capabilities is underscored by the staggering estimate from the U.S. debris-tracking program, which identifies more than 100 million objects larger than 1 millimeter in orbit. Alarmingly, less than 1 percent of these pose a serious risk to active missions and are currently being monitored. This stark reality highlights the critical importance of developing methods to track smaller pieces of debris, as the frequency of collision avoidance and the need for evasive actions continually increase.
The findings of this groundbreaking research were detailed in a paper published in the journal Physics of Plasmas, which offers a comprehensive account of the team‚Äôs methodologies and discoveries. Featuring as lead author Bengt Eliasson from the University of Strathclyde, the paper elucidates the generation of specific electromagnetic waves as satellite instruments navigate through ionospheric irregularities.
The convergence of efforts, spurred by support from the Office of the Director of National Intelligence, is fostering collaborative endeavors with contractors such as Blue Halo. This partnership aims to bolster the United States‚Äô capacity for identifying and tracking space debris through the Intelligence Advanced Research Projects Activity‚Äôs (IARPA) Space Debris Identification and Tracking program, reflecting the heightened focus on this pressing issue.
As satellite operators currently face countless collision avoidance actions each year‚Äî20,000 annually for systems like Starlink‚Äîthe stakes are higher than ever. The culmination of these efforts promises not only to enhance detection capabilities but also to pave the way for innovative new approaches to combat the challenges posed by an ever-growing orbital debris field. As research continues, the route to safeguarding our satellites and ensuring the longevity of space operations will increasingly rely on scientific advancements in debris tracking and avoidance strategies.
Thus, as the Space Debris Hunter embarks on its mission, it symbolizes a hope for a more secure future in Earth‚Äôs orbit, where satellites operate safely amid a sea of orbital debris. The research community firmly believes that through dedicated exploration and innovation, solutions to one of space exploration‚Äôs most daunting challenges can be found, ensuring the preservation of a sustainable space environment for generations to come.
Subject of Research : Space debris detection and tracking
Article Title : The generation of whistler, lower hybrid, and magnetosonic waves by satellites passing through ionospheric magnetic field aligned irregularities
News Publication Date : February 8, 2025
Web References : Physics of Plasmas
References : DOI: 10.1063/5.0225399
Image Credits : Not provided.
Keywords Space debris, satellite tracking, electromagnetic waves, orbit safety, collision avoidance, plasma disturbances, space research, University of Alaska Fairbanks.

author: Stevie Daniels
title: Dangerous heat to end the week
text:
BALTIMORE ‚Äî Happy Friday! Today will be very toasty with high temperatures returning back into the upper-90s this afternoon with heat index values in the triple digits. Heat Advisories will go into effect from 12 pm - 8 pm for the entire area as it could feel as hot as 109¬∞ in some areas. This will fuel another round of afternoon storms and showers. Today's storm chance looks more widespread with scattered storms developing during the afternoon and evening. Damaging winds will be the top concerns. The heat and humidity stick around this weekend with a stormy set up during the afternoon. Highs cool a bit next week eventually dropping into the upper-80s next week.
Have a sunny day!
wmar 7 Day Forecast:
Friday Scattered showers and thunderstorms. Partly sunny and hot, with a high near 98. Heat index values as high as 109. South wind 5-10 mph.
Friday Night Showers and thunderstorms likely. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 75. East wind 5-10mph becoming southwest in the evening.
Saturday Scattered showers and thunderstorms. Partly sunny, with a high near 93.
Saturday Night Showers and thunderstorms. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 73.
Sunday A chance of showers, with thunderstorms. Partly sunny, with a high near 90.
Sunday Night Partly cloudy, with a low around 72.
Monday Sunny, with a high near 94.
Monday Night Partly cloudy, with a low around 73.
Tuesday Mostly sunny, with a high near 91.
Tuesday Night A chance of showers and thunderstorms. Partly cloudy, with a low around 71.
Wednesday A chance of showers and thunderstorms. Partly sunny, with a high near 88.
Wednesday Night A chance of showers and thunderstorms. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 70.
Thursday A chance of showers. Partly sunny, with a high near 87.

author: Press Association
title: Inverness-shire BBC weather presenter Carol Kirkwood marries partner in intimate wedding - Press and Journal
text:
Inverness-shire BBC weather presenter Carol Kirkwood marries partner in intimate wedding By Press Association December 29 2023, 8.29am Share Inverness-shire BBC weather presenter Carol Kirkwood marries partner in intimate wedding Share via Facebook Twitter Whatsapp Messenger Linkedin Email Post link https://www.pressandjournal.co.uk/entertainment/tv-film/6310653/on-cloud-nine-bbc-weather-presenter-carol-kirkwood-ties-the-knot/ Copy Link Carol Kirkwood has tied the knot with her ‚Äòsecret boyfriend‚Äô in a romantic and intimate wedding (Ian West/PA)
Inverness-shire BBC weather presenter Carol Kirkwood has married her partner in an intimate wedding.
Carol, from Morar, tied the knot with Steve on Wednesday in Buckinghamshire.
The popular presenter told BBC News : ‚ÄúIt was the most perfect and romantic and intimate wedding.
‚ÄúWe are both so incredibly happy.‚Äù
A message on X, formerly Twitter, from the BBC Breakfast account wished the couple well saying: ‚ÄúCongratulations Carol & Steve. Best wishes from your #BBCBreakfast colleagues.‚Äù
Pictures shared by the BBC Breakfast X account show Kirkwood wearing a boat neckline satin dress, holding a bouquet of roses.
Congratulations Carol & Steve.
‚ÄòIt was the most perfect and romantic and intimate wedding. We are both so incredibly happy‚Äô @carolkirkwood
Best wishes from your #BBCBreakfast colleagues ‚ù§Ô∏è üéâ üíí
Photos: Abi Chadwick pic.twitter.com/s73QIEFCvY
‚Äî BBC Breakfast (@BBCBreakfast) December 29, 2023
Former BBC Breakfast host Dan Walker was among those congratulating Kirkwood, writing on X: ‚ÄúCongratulations to Carol and Steve.
‚ÄúSteve is one very fortunate gentleman and Carol is the best of us all.
‚ÄúI wish them every happiness in their new life together @carolkirkwood‚Äù.
Carol Kirkwood discusses ‚Äòromantic‚Äô proposal In May last year, Kirkwood revealed the couple were engaged on BBC Breakfast, saying she had had ‚Äúabsolutely no idea‚Äù Steve was going to propose.
She was congratulated on air about the engagement by her BBC Breakfast colleagues Sally Nugent and Jon Kay as she reported from the Chelsea Flower Show.
Asked by Kay if it had been a ‚Äúformal, one-knee thing‚Äù, Kirkwood said: ‚ÄúYes, it was, we went out for a picnic. I had absolutely no idea.
‚ÄúThe weather was glorious. We were sitting chatting, and then my other half was a wee bit nervous for some reason, which I didn‚Äôt know.
‚ÄúAnd he was fumbling in his pocket and then out came a ring and I thought he was joking actually, I didn‚Äôt believe him to start with, but it was lovely.‚Äù
She added that it was ‚Äúquite romantic‚Äù before telling her co-presenters: ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre making me really embarrassed now.‚Äù
BBC Weather presenter wanted to keep partner out of public eye Kirkwood had not previously publicly named her long-time partner or his surname and, speaking while promoting her debut romantic novel titled Under A Greek Moon in 2021, she told the PA News agency: ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs only a secret boyfriend because I never talk about him.
‚ÄúI always feel that, through my job, I put myself in the public eye and am very happy, but my partner and my family and my friends haven‚Äôt, so I‚Äôm hugely respectful of their privacy.
‚ÄúI just don‚Äôt talk about them, other than to say that my partner is drop-dead gorgeous, he‚Äôs funny, he makes me very happy.‚Äù
She added: ‚ÄúHe gets up at quarter to three in the morning to make me a cup of tea before going to work ‚Äì if that‚Äôs not romantic, I don‚Äôt know what is.‚Äù
Under A Greek Moon is about a Hollywood actress embroiled in a scandal who returns to the Greek island where she fell in love with an enigmatic tycoon.
Appearing as the cover star for Prima magazine‚Äôs February 2024 issue, she said it ‚Äúwill be nice to retire one day and focus on my writing‚Äù but at the moment she is embracing her dual jobs.
She was previously married for 25 years to businessman Jimmy Kirkwood before they divorced.

author: @Developpez
title: Microsoft tente de convaincre les utilisateurs de Windows 10 d'acheter de nouveaux PC munis de Windows 11 au travers d'invites en plein √©cran
text:
Depuis des mois, Microsoft tente de convaincre les utilisateurs de Windows 10 de passer √† Windows 11, avant la date de fin de support de Windows 10 en octobre 2025. Au d√©but de l'ann√©e, Microsoft a commenc√© √† utiliser des invites en plein √©cran pour avertir les utilisateurs de Windows 10 de la fin du support, et maintenant elle utilise des invites similaires pour tenter d'inciter les gens √† acheter un nouveau PC Windows 11 √† la place.
Certains utilisateurs de Windows 10 viennent de remarquer de nouvelles invites en plein √©cran qui sugg√®rent de passer √† Windows 11 ¬´ avec lequel il est possible de faire plus. ¬ª Comme pour les messages du d√©but de l'ann√©e, le lien ¬´ En savoir plus ¬ª renvoie √† un site promotionnel qui propose des liens vers les nouveaux PC Windows 11.
L'invite plein √©cran de Microsoft ne mentionne pas que les utilisateurs de Windows 10 peuvent continuer √† utiliser le syst√®me d'exploitation en toute s√©curit√© au-del√† du 14 octobre 2025. Microsoft offrira pour la premi√®re fois des mises √† jour de s√©curit√© √©tendues aux consommateurs, mais les utilisateurs de Windows 10 devront payer 30 $ pour un an de mises √† jour suppl√©mentaires. Les clients commerciaux pourront acheter jusqu'√† trois ans de mises √† jour suppl√©mentaires.
Microsoft a d√©j√† eu recours √† ce type d'invites par le pass√©, en incitant fortement les utilisateurs de Windows 7 et Windows 8.1 √† mettre √† jour leur version de Windows 10. Windows 11 n'est pris en charge que par les processeurs lanc√©s √† partir de 2018, de sorte que ces derni√®res invites ne mentionnent probablement que la mise √† niveau de votre PC au lieu d'essayer de mettre √† niveau vers Windows 11, car des millions d'appareils existants ne peuvent tout simplement pas √™tre officiellement mis √† niveau.Microsoft is running full-screen ads for Windows 11 on Windows 10, including Copilot+ PC ads. This is part of Microsoft's efforts to force people to upgrade to Windows 11 before the Windows 10 support deadline:
‚Äî Windows Latest (@WindowsLatest)[https://t.co/2GPJztoO9f][#Windows11][pic.twitter.com/NSq3YvZFIB][November 20, 2024]
L'adoption de Windows 11 reste inf√©rieure √† celle de Windows 10, bien qu'il soit bri√®vement devenu le syst√®me d'exploitation le plus populaire pour les jeux sur PC sur Steam au d√©but de l'√©t√©. Microsoft a en sus compliqu√© sa communication sur la fin du support de Windows 10 en continuant d'ajouter de nouvelles fonctionnalit√©s au syst√®me d'exploitation. Apr√®s avoir initialement d√©clar√© qu'il n'y aurait plus de mises √† jour majeures de Windows 10 en 2023, Microsoft a ensuite pris l'initiative inhabituelle de rouvrir son programme b√™ta pour les utilisateurs de Windows 10 en juin afin de tester de nouvelles fonctionnalit√©s pour un syst√®me d'exploitation que Microsoft souhaite voir cesser d'utiliser l'ann√©e prochaine.
Et vous ?
Quelle est votre exp√©rience personnelle avec Windows 11 en tant quutilisateur ? Partagez vos anecdotes
Les d√©veloppements en cours dans l√©cosyst√®me Windows vous inspirent-ils une certaine nostalgie dune pr√©c√©dente mouture de Windows ? Quel syst√®me dexploitation de Windows vous a marqu√© au point de remonter dans votre souvenir dans ce contexte de multiplications de critiques contre Windows 11 ? Windows 98 ? Windows XP ? Windows 2000 ? Windows 7 ?
Avez-vous envisag√© de passer √† Linux au vu des d√©veloppements en cours dans l√©cosyst√®me Windows ?
Voir aussi :
[¬´ Linux sur Desktop est une catastrophe de Tchernobyl ¬ª pour le cr√©ateur de GNOME qui n'a pas lanc√© son poste Linux depuis fin 2012](https://www.antipope.org/charlie/blog-static/2024/06/is-microsoft-trying-to-commit-.html)
[Le support des applications Linux d√©barque en pr√©version sur Chrome OS dans un premier temps sur Pixelbook](https://www.developpez.com/actu/202737/Le-support-des-applications-Linux-debarque-en-preversion-sur-Chrome-OS-dans-un-premier-temps-sur-Pixelbook/)
[¬´ L'ann√©e de l'ordinateur de bureau Linux est arriv√©e ¬ª selon le Directeur de la Technologie d'Intel](https://www.developpez.com/actu/61556/-L-annee-de-l-ordinateur-de-bureau-Linux-est-arrivee-selon-le-Directeur-de-la-Technologie-d-Intel/)
[2017 est officiellement l'ann√©e de Linux desktop selon un utilisateur de macOS : le patron de la Fondation Linux, quel message aux fans de Linux ?](https://www.developpez.com/actu/160930/2017-est-officiellement-l-annee-de-Linux-desktop-selon-un-utilisateur-de-macOS-le-patron-de-la-Fondation-Linux-quel-message-aux-fans-de-Linux/)

author: The Business Research Company
title: 2024 Barrier Systems Market Report : Market Size, Growth
text:
2024 Barrier Systems Market Report : Market Size, Growth Drivers, And Key Trends 11-22-2024 12:26 PM CET | Advertising, Media Consulting, Marketing Research
Press release from: The Business Research Company Barrier Systems Global Market Report 2024
"The Business Research Company recently released a comprehensive report on the Global Barrier Systems Market Size and Trends Analysis with Forecast 2024-2033. This latest market research report offers a wealth of valuable insights and data, including global market size, regional shares, and competitor market share. Additionally, it covers current trends, future opportunities, and essential data for success in the industry.
According to The Business Research Company's, The barrier systems market size has grown strongly in recent years. It will grow from $19.4 billion in 2023 to $20.74 billion in 2024 at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 6.9%. The growth in the historic period can be attributed to road safety regulations, infrastructure development, rise in automotive accidents, focus on work zone safety, public awareness of road safety, stringent safety standards.
The barrier systems market size is expected to see strong growth in the next few years. It will grow to $26.24 billion in 2028 at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 6.1%. The growth in the forecast period can be attributed to smart transportation systems, focus on sustainable infrastructure, urban mobility solutions, resilience to climate change, rise in demand for high-performance barriers. Major trends in the forecast period include innovations in crash barrier technologies, integration of smart technologies, sustainable and eco-friendly materials, customization for specific applications, integration with intelligent transportation systems.
Get The Complete Scope Of The Report @
https://www.thebusinessresearchcompany.com/report/barrier-systems-global-market-report
Market Drivers and Trends:
Increasing incidents of road accidents are expected to propel the growth of the barrier systems market going forward. A road accident refers to an incident involving the crashing of a motor vehicle that leads wounded or killed at least one person. Barrier systems are used to prevent vehicles from leaving the road and colliding with roadside hazards such as slopes (roadside barriers) that pass into the line of oncoming traffic and also assist in controlling vehicle speeds, managing lanes and traffic flow, and guiding traffic away from any road dangers. For instance, in August 2022, according to the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, a US-based government agency, 9,560 individuals died in traffic accidents in the first quarter of 2022, an increase of 7% compared to the 8,935 fatalities for the same time period in 2021. Therefore, an increase in road accidents drives the growth of the barrier system market.
Product innovations are the key trend gaining popularity in the barrier systems market. Major companies operating in the barrier systems market are focusing on innovative products to sustain their position in the market. For instance, in May 2022, Seton UK, a UK-based manufacturer of workplace safety products, launched EasyExtend, a new modular retractable barrier system. It is a new retractable barrier system with distinct features and advantages for use in industrial and outdoor settings. It has a larger span than comparable retractable barriers on the market, resulting in more efficient resource utilization. It can be used with ordinary traffic cones or fastened directly to walls or other surfaces using its dedicated post and base system. The EasyExtend also stores all of the barrier components inside the base, making it perfect for quick and easy assembly in the event of a hazard and storing in stacks with little space.

author: @KRGV
title: Condado Hidalgo reparte calentadores para combatir las bajas temperaturas
text: Condado Hidalgo reparte calentadores para combatir las bajas temperaturas Ante el pron√≥stico de viento fr√≠o y las bajas temperaturas registradas en el Valle, la Agencia de Servicios Comunitarios del condado Hidalgo busca atender las necesidades de las personas m√°s vulnerables. Por ello, estar√°n ofreciendo calentadores y un detector de humo a 100 familias que no tienen suficientes medios para calentar sus hogares. Entre los criterios en cuenta debe haber un miembro mayor de 60 a√±os, ni√±os menores de cinco a√±os o un miembro con alguna discapacidad. Para calificar se pedir√° llenar una aplicaci√≥n, adem√°s debe mostrar los ingresos en su hogar, los cuales deben ser igual o menor al 150 por ciento del nivel de pobreza. Adem√°s, debe mostrar identificaci√≥n y prueba de residencia como un recibo de luz, agua o gas. "Esos fondos que utilizamos para comprar que son los calentadores tambi√©n los utilizamos para pagar los biles de la luz. Pueden calificar para un calentador y tambi√©n pueden calificar para que les ayudemos a pagar los biles de la luz en el futuro para que puedan utilizar los fondos para que se ayuden", dijo Jaime Longoria, director de Servicios Comunitarios del condado Hidalgo. Si usted cree que califica para recibir un calentador, estos est√°n disponibles en la oficina principal ubicada en 2524 N. Closner en Edinburg. Las personas pueden aplicar en l√≠nea en [www.hidalgocsa.org](https://hidalgocsa.org/) o pueden llamar al 956-383-6240 para m√°s informaci√≥n. Por su parte, Jaime Longoria habl√≥ con Noticias RGV sobre la importancia de tomar algunas precauciones al usar calentadores el√©ctricos para evitar cualquier tragedia. "Tambi√©n les quiero recordar, al utilizar un calentador, un calentador de luz, aseg√∫rense de que la conexi√≥n sea directamente al enchufe de la luz en la pared, que no se utilicen lo que son cordones de extensi√≥n, porque eso es algo muy peligroso", agreg√≥ Longoria. Longoria a√±adi√≥ que es importante asegurarse que los calentadores no est√©n colocados cerca de material inflamable como cortinas y que tambi√©n es necesario colocar detectores de humo en las casas. More News News Video - Donna police seeking man accused of shooting girlfriend in the shoulder - Witnesses testifying in Victor Godinez trial detail tense manhunt for suspect - La Feria high school students receive ‚Äòreality check‚Äô ahead of graduation - Edinburg actress celebrating landing role in new Marvel series - Man killed in shooting near Edinburg identified, sheriff's office investigating

author: Paige Clark
title: Perdita tragica per John Elway, poich√© il suo migliore amico Jeff Sperbeck √® deceduto in un incidente con il golf cart all'et√† di 62 anni.
text:
Una Giornata Straziante sul Verde
Una giornata serena sul campo da golf si √® trasformata in tragedia quando un confidente di lunga data e partner commerciale ha subito un incidente fatale. Ci√≤ che era iniziato come un normale giro di golf si √® trasformato in un momento di profondo dolore che ha lasciato un segno indelebile in tutti coloro che hanno amato la sua memoria.
Un Legame Che Ha Superato Gli Affari
Per decenni, un‚Äôamicizia straordinaria √® fiorita tra un celebre icona della NFL e il suo stimato associato. La loro relazione andava ben oltre le ambizioni professionali; era costruita su rispetto reciproco, passioni condivise e una fiducia incrollabile. Come partner, si sono persino avventurati nel mondo del vino pregiato, fondando una cantina che rappresenta un testamento ai loro sogni comuni e alla loro connessione duratura.
L‚ÄôIncidente e le Immediate Conseguenze
Durante una sessione di golf rilassante nel suggestivo scenario di La Quinta, si √® verificato un incidente imprevisto. Mentre viaggiava in un golf cart, il compagno stretto √® caduto inaspettatamente dal veicolo, riportando un grave infortunio alla testa. Nonostante le tempestive misure di emergenza e gli sforzi di supporto vitale, √® deceduto poco dopo a causa delle ferite. L‚Äôincidente ha portato a un‚Äôindagine approfondita, che alla fine ha scagionato il conducente da qualsiasi colpa, sottolineando la natura tragica e imprevedibile dell‚Äôevento piuttosto che qualsiasi errore da parte di qualcuno.
Eredit√† e Riflessioni su una Vita Ben Vissuta
L‚Äôamico scomparso non era solo un consulente fidato, ma anche un pilastro significativo nella vita del suo partner, influenzando sia il campo personale che quello professionale. Il suo impegno costante, la sua acuta intuizione e la sua genuina cura hanno arricchito ogni aspetto delle sue imprese, lasciando un‚Äôeredit√† che continuer√† a ispirare. La perdita risuona profondamente, ricordando a tutti coloro che lo conoscevano la fragilit√† della vita e l‚Äôimportanza di apprezzare ogni attimo fugace.
Un Futuro Ispirato al Ricordo
Mentre le riflessioni su questo triste incidente si assestano, coloro che rimangono sono incoraggiati ad abbracciare i ricordi che hanno definito la loro relazione. La storia di questa amicizia duratura √® un potente promemoria che, anche in mezzo a una tragedia imprevista, i legami che creiamo possono illuminare i percorsi futuri. L‚Äôeredit√† di una vita vissuta con passione e profondamente amata ora apre la strada a futuri impegni, invitando alla contemplazione sull‚Äôimpatto duraturo dell‚Äôamicizia, della lealt√† e del fine condiviso.

author: JACKSON WALKER | The National Desk
title: chevron-right
text: {p}Sunday will be a lot calmer than Saturday with some nice sunbreaks for the morning and most of the afternoon. Showers will start moving back after sunset. Highs today will hit the mid to upper 50s.{/p}{p}Showers will take over tonight making for a wet start to your Monday morning. Lows should drop to the upper 40s in most spots.{/p}{p}Monday will have frequent showers and the chance of a thundershower or two. The best chance to hear the rumble of thunder will be along the ocean beaches, areas south of Tacoma, and in the Puget Sound Convergence Zone of north King and south Snohomish Counties. Highs on Monday will make it to the mid to upper 50s once again.{/p}{p}Rain will continue on Tuesday under gray skies. Highs should drop back to a bit to the mid-50s.{/p}{p}Right now the forecast models say Wednesday should bring mostly dry weather with some sunbreaks. It will not be all that warm with daytime highs only getting to the low to mid-50s.{/p}{p}Theron Zahn{br}The KOMO 4-Cast Team{br}{/p}{p}{strong}Updated Sunday Morning{/strong}{/p}{p}Rep. Rashida Tlaib, D-Mich., condemned Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Wednesday by claiming he had committed war crimes while defending his country from Hamas terrorists.{br}{/p}{p}‚ÄúGenocidal maniac,‚Äù Rep. Tlaib, a member of the ultra-progressive congressional group \"The Squad,\" jeered in a fiery Instagram story post.{/p}{blockquote}‚ÄúEvery member of Congress who sits down with this murderer is supporting a war criminal,\" she continued. \"We will never ever forget.‚Äù{/blockquote}{p}The post was one of several in a string condemning Israel and President Joe Biden for continuing to support the Jewish state's war efforts.{/p}{p}Rep. Tlaib, who is Palestinian-American, has been a fierce supporter of Palestine as the war continues between Hamas terrorists and Israel. She was {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/top-videos/house-votes-to-censure-rep-rashida-tlaib-over-her-israel-hamas-rhetoric-in-a-stunning-rebuke-white-house-united-states-palestine-war-marjorie-taylor-greene-government-politics\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/top-videos/house-votes-to-censure-rep-rashida-tlaib-over-her-israel-hamas-rhetoric-in-a-stunning-rebuke-white-house-united-states-palestine-war-marjorie-taylor-greene-government-politics\"}censured {/a}by Congress in November in connection to her rhetoric about the war.{/p}{p}{strong}READ MORE |{ }{a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/aoc-slammed-for-christmas-message-claiming-jesus-was-palestinian-ignorant-illiterate-embarrassment#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/aoc-slammed-for-christmas-message-claiming-jesus-was-palestinian-ignorant-illiterate-embarrassment#\"}AOC slammed for Christmas message comparing Jesus to Palestinians{/a}{/strong}{/p}{p}The censureship has hardly dampened her language, however.
